CatDescriptText: Ephriam Wolfolk A/3c, Bolling Field, D.C. and Shirley Evans, Internal Revenue employee, Homewood, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper December 2,1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that single persons and "socially undesirables," displaced by urban redevelopment programs, should be compelled to find new homes for themselves, or should some other agent be held responsible?" Mr. Wolfolk's answer reads: "A person forced to move should have some assistance in finding a new home, if he's done all he could do, on his own.  Persons in redevelopment areas should realized they have to move and should make some effort on their own to find a home." Ms. Evans' answer reads: "Some agency should be responsible.  And when you say 'socially undesirable,' you have to ask why?  The answer is in the agencies which are supposed to keep people from becoming 'undesirable.'  Evidently, they must not be doing their jobs if this is the case.  In redevelopment areas, most single persons seek their own homes, but anyone appreciates help."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ephriam Wolfolk wearing dark U.S. Army uniform standing in front of store with sign reading "Quantities Limited", and partial woman on left wearing plaid shirt, and dark coat, Downtown; Portrait of Shirley Evans wearing plaid coat, holding paper bag, standing in front of store, Downtown
